title: Allgood Ride The Bee   320 kbps

2. Chore Boy

6. Can\&#039;t Get Next to You

Clay Fuller Guitar

Mike Sain Vocals 
John D. Willis Guitar (Acoustic) 
Corky Jones Vocals 
John A. Carter Guitar 
John Hermann Organ 
Chuck Leavell Organ, Piano 
Why the hell were\&#039;nt this band BIG? The music is totally awesome. Besides the hot guitar skills on offer here, it was the distinctive vocals of Corky Jones that I enjoyed the most. As another reviewer put it, a mix of Allman Brothers and Stevie Ray Vaughan was spot on. However, I am sure that reviewer will agree with me that the comparison to S R V is NOT the sound of the guitar but the sound of vocal. I much prefer Corkys tones as they are not so nasal. My two favourite tunes are \"Ease on my way\" (For the vocals) and \"Mornin\" (For the guitar - You need to check out the extended version of this on the Live and Screaming CD). I also enjoyed \"Time is gonna bring us a change\" and the softer \"With you\", not to mention a great rendition of the Buddy Miles Tune \"Them Changes\" Popularised by Jimi Hendrix. I dont know if this band are still playing, but if they are, I would jump at the chance of seeing them, more so than say, Government Mule or the Allmans for example.
